review_content: A large can from Jason's near NCCU. Aroma: grapefruit, floral notes. Appearance: opaque dark amber, generous bubbly head with a pinkish tinge. Palate: medium-bodied and oily, fizzy carbonation, astringent finish. Taste: heavily bitter with sweet notes; citrus, something biscuity at the finish. Drinkable.

500ml can bought at K-Mart Korean Food in Sham Shui Po. 

Looks: Translucent orange honey with trace of misty yeast particlesTwo five finger head with soapy off-white foam which last for 2 minutes; Fair sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant Ale malt, with strong oranges, pineapples, honey, grapefruits, citrus, yellow fruits, caramel, toffee, red fruits, floral, sugar, spices, thick bread, lemon and grass.

Taste: Mid to strong sweet Ale malt, with pretty strong Amberness, strong grapefruits, red fruits, light caramel, floral, sugar, spices, strong herbs, pine, resins, biscuits, strong lemon, mid to strong bitter hops and strong grass.

Body: Mid to full body. Slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Good Amber Ale maltyness in a solid but carbo-ish background, pretty bock-ish and Munich-like with notable caramel and red fruits. Strong grapefruit and lemony hops dominate with good herbal character. Flowery with right amount of strong sweetness. Piney, slightly oozy and biscuity with strong grass to round. Solid!

Hoppiness: Strong oranges, pineapples, honey, grapefruits, citrus, yellow fruits, floral, spices, lemon and grass in nose. Strong grapefruits, floral, spices, strong herbs, pine, resins, strong lemon and strong grass in taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, closer-to-high level bitter Amber malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Piney herbal grapefruit and bitter to mouth.	

Comments: After having two sub-par Kumiho beers (the Peach Ale and Relax Beer), this one finally means business: good solid Amber Ale body, nice tropical fruiy hops aroma with strong grapefruit and herbal piney taste, round with strong lemon and grass. A cross between American and traditional English IPA, this is decent and worth every penny!
